etymologies: mid 19th century (denoting the left hand or a punch with the left hand): the usage in baseball is from the orientation of the diamond to the same points of the compass, causing the pitcher to have his left hand on the south side of his body

definitions: a left-handed person, especially a boxer who leads with the right hand or a baseball pitcher

examples.text: he needed three rounds to work out the Mexican southpaw before taking over
Penalosa's lack of mobility is counterbalanced by his southpaw stance

shortDefinitions: left-handed boxer who leads with right hand
